Noverit univerſitas veſtra nos conceſſiſſe Joni & heredibus ſuis Berchariam noſtram ducentarum ovium, ſcil. medietatem de Oſmundeſeye in terra & mariſco cum una ſalina, Tenend. de nobis ſucceſſivè ad Gavelykende it a plenèGavelykende. & integrè ſicut eam unquam Rogerus de Oſmundeſeye tenuit. Reddendo inde nobis annuatim lvj. s. de redditu ad duos terminos, ſcil. ad feſtum S. Johannis Baptiſtae xxviij. s. & ad feſtum S. Michaelis ſimiliter viginti octo. Poſt mortem verò praedicti Jonis dabunt nobis heredes ſui ſucceſſivè de Relevio lvj. s. Dabunt etiam idem J. &Relevium. heredes ſui poſt ipſum nobis annuatim ad Natale Domini unum Mathlardum, et unam Annat • m, & quatuor cercellas, & ad Paſcha unum caſeum, & unum agnum de Preſent. Preſent. Super hoc ſciendum, quod praedictus J. et heredes ſui Curiam noſtram de Leyſdun
ſequentur, & in auxiliis dandis & Scottis ſicut alii Tenentes noſtri ſcottabunt. Et inde ipſe & heredes ſui ſucceſſivè ſalvos plegios invenient de redditu terminis ſtatutis reddendo, & de Berchariae inſtanratione integrè & fideliter conſervanda.

div.head: Alia conſimilis Charta Hoſpitali data.
div.p:
Sciant preſentes & futuri, quod egoScriptura 9 Vide pag 38. & 55. Radulfus Frone tradidi & conceſſi Deo & fratribus Hoſpitalis S. Laurentii juxta Cantuariam, in orientali parte ſiti, ſeptem acras terrae meae tenendas in Gavelekende deGavelekende. me & heredibus meis liberè & quietè. Reddendo inde annuatim mihi vel heredibus meis xlij. denarios, pro omni ſervitio, & omni exactione in duobus terminis, ſcil. in med. Quadrageſimâ xxj. denar. & in feſto▪ S. Michaelis xxj. denar. Praedicta autem terra nominata eſt Preſteſteghe, quae adjacet terrae Heliae de Blen. Pro hac donatione & confirmatione dederunt mihi praedicti fratres & heredibus meis quinque marcas ſterlingorum. His teſtibus Johanne clerico,
filio Henrici Sacerdotis, &c. & pluribus de Halymot.

div.head: Inquiſitio de terris & tenementis quae Iſabella de Monte alto tenuit de Priore eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuariae.
div.p:
Inquiſitio facta apud Hokynden coramScriptura 10. Vide pag 58. Eſchaetore Domini Regis die Mercurii prox▪ ante feſtum S. Catherinae virginis, anno R. R. Edwardi ſecundo, de terris & tenementis quae Iſabella de monte alto tenuit de Priore Eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuariae, & per quod ſervitiū, per ſacramentū Willmi de Cokeler, &c. qui dicūt per ſacramentū ſuū, quod praedicta Iſabella tenuit in Gavelikende dieGavelikende. quo obiit de praedicto Priore unū meſſuagiū xlij. acras terrae cum pertinentiis in Hokinden, per ſervitium decem ſolid. undecim denarior. per annum, & per ſervitium arandi unam acram terrae ad ſeminandum frumentum, quod valet xij. d. per annum. Et per ſervitium metendi praedictam acram & cariandi in Grangiam Prioris apud Orpinton
blada ejuſdem acrae, quod ſervitium extendit per annum ad xij. d. Et per ſervitium arandi dimidiam acram terrae ad ſeminandum frumentum, et dimidiam acram terrae ad ſeminandum ordeum, et utramque dimidiam acram metendi et ligandi, quod quidem ſervitium extendit per annum ad ij. s. Et per ſervitium ſolvendi unam denar. et obulum ad falcandum pratum Domini Prioris, & per ſervitium curiandi unam carectatam & dimidiam feni in Grangiam Prioris apud Orpinton, & valet per annum iij. denar. Et per per ſervitium faciendi duo averagia de Orpinton uſque Mepham per annum, & valet opus viij. denar. Et per ſervitium claudendi tres peticatas circa Gardinum Prioris praedicti apud Orpinton, & valet opus iij. d. per annum. Et per ſervitium duarum gallinarum & xl. ovorum, et valet per annum vj. d. pretium gallinae ij. d. Et per ſervitium faciendi ſectam ad curiam praedicti Prioris de Orpinton, de tribus ſeptimanis in tres ſeptimanas. Et dicunt quod praedicta Iſabella obiit per tres annos
elapſos, et quod areragia à tempore mortis praedictae Iſabellae uſque in hodiernum diem ſunt l. s. j. d. ob.

div.head: Servitia Tenentium de Rokinge ad redditum poſita.
div.p:
Memorand. quod in feſto S. Michaelis, Scriptura 1 • . Vide pag. 60. anno Dni Mcclxxxix. regni verò Regis Edwardi xvij. Prior et Conventus eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuar. relaxaverunt Tenentibus ſuis de Rokinge, viz. falcationem, levationem, cariagium, et taſſationem prati. Item cariagium, impletionem & ſparſionem fimorum, facturam cratis, & Burghyard. ItemBurghyard. averagia apud Merſeham. Item fotaveagia. Item meſſionem & herciaturam & collectionem ſtipularum. Item cooperturam grangiarum, & tonſionem ovium. Et pro iſta relaxatione, praedicti Tenentes ſolvent annuatim ad manerium praedict. in feſto omnium Sanctorum, & ad Purificationem beatae Mariae
redditus ſubſcriptos pro equali portione viz. Robertus le Frode de xij. acris & dimid. iiij. s. ij. d. ob. Timberdanſland pro viginti ſex acris iiij. s. ij. d. ob. Terra Heymund pro novem acris iij. s. ij. d. Terra Juliani pro viginti acris iiij. s. j. d. ob. Stamereſland pro undecim acris ij. s. viij. d. Terra Smalſpon pro treſdecim acris ij. s. iiij. d. Terra le Bred pro octo acris & dimid. xvj. d. &c.

div.head: Relaxatio ſervitiorum & conſuetudinum Tenentium de Mepham, pro annuo redditu ſolvendo.
div.p:
Ʋniverſis pateat per praeſentes quod in
•… iptura 12. •… e pag. 6 • . feſto Nativitatis Domini, Anno ejuſdem Mcccvj. Regni verò Regis Edwardi filii Regis Henrici xxxv. Henricus Prior et Capitulum eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuar. remiſerunt et relaxaverunt hominibus et tenentibus ſuis de Mepham quaſdam conſuetudines el ſervitia pro annuo redditu quinquaginta ſeptem ſolidor. trium denarior. et unius oboli • iſdem Priori et Capitulo in praedicto manerio
ſuo de Mepham in feſto Apostolorum Petri et Pauli annuatim ſolvend. in formà ſubſcriptà, viz. Tenentes de Gavellond deGavellond. octodecim Jugis, pro cariagio triginta et ſex carectat. feni de prato de Redhamme apud Clyve uſque Mepham, quindecim ſolidos, viz. pro qualibet carectat. quinque denarios. Et unum dimidium jugum eſt in Dominico. Item pro averagiis treſdecim ſolid. & quatuor denar. Item pro clauſura circa blada duos ſolidos, undecim denar. & obulum. Item pro clauſura circa Curiam quae dicitur Burghyard. viginti duos denar. obulumBurghyard. & quadr. Item Tenentes de ſex Jugis & dimid. de Inland pro trituratione & ventilationeInland. triginta & quinque quarteriorum frumenti, novem ſolid. quinquc denar. obolum & quadr. viz. pro trituratione cujuſlibet ſummae tres denar. & pro ventilatione unum quadr. Item pro trituratione & ventilatione ſeptemdecim groſſarum ſummarum et dimid avenae, tres ſolid. tres denar. & unum quadr. viz. pro trituratione cujuſlibet ſummae duos denar. et pro ventilatione unum quadran. Item pro opere ſarclandi
octodecim denar. Item pro opere taſſandi in autumpno treſdecim denar. Item pro fimis ſpargendis ſex denar. et obolum. Item pro xviij. f. Cl • yis, vel Claiis. Vid. Spelm. Gloſſar. in voce. Worderinde. Cladibus faciendis ad Ovile ſex denar. Item pro cibo Prioris querend. et pro ſervitio quod dicitur Worderinde, et pro pomis frangendis duodecim denar. Item pro clauſura circa blada, quae dicitur Swinhey, Swinhey. duos ſolidos, decem denar. et quadr. Item pro clauſura xvj. perticarum et quinque pedum muri infra Curiam ab oſtio Aulae verſus Portam Curiae xvj. denar. et obol. Item pro grangia cooperienda duos ſolid. et ſex denar. In quorum omnium teſtimonium, ſigillum commune praedictorum Prioris et Capituli, et ſigilla Walteri de Northwode, Johannis de Iſebergh, Johannis de Halifeld, Henrici de Mildenacre, Petri de Mildenacre, et Johannis de Preſtwode, pro ſe et omnibus aliis Tenentibus de Gavellond, ad requiſitionem ipſorum: et Johannis de Pettesfeld, Johannis de la Dene Capellani, Henrici de Lomere, Alfredi de Northwode, Henrici de Northwode, et Walteri Ive, pro ſe et omnibus aliis Tenentibus de Inland, ad requiſitionem eorundem,
huic ſcripto cirographato alternatim ſunt appenſa. Acta ſunt haec anno ſupradicto.

div.head: Breve Regis (Wmi jmi) pro terris monaſterii S. Auguſtini Cant. alienatis recuperandis.
div.p: Willmus Dei gratiâ Rex Angliae, Lanfranco Scriptura 13. Vide pag. 68. Archiepiſco Cantuar. &c. Salutem. Mando & praecipio ut faciatis S. Auguſtinum & Abbatem Scotlandum reſeiſire burgum de Fordwich, quem tenet Haymo vicecomes, omneſque alias terras quas Abbas Egelſinus fugitivus, mentis lenitate, vel timore, vel cupiditate alicui dedit vel habere conceſſit. Et ſi aliquis, &c.

div.head: Charta W. Regis jmi de reſtitutione ablatorum in Epiſcopatibus & Abbatiis totius Angliae.
div.p:
W. Dei gratiâ Rex Anglorum, L. ArchiepiſcopoScriptura 14. Vide pag. 68. Cantuar. & G. Epiſcopo Conſtantiarum, & R. Comiti de Ou, & R. filio
Comitis Gil. & H. de monte forti, ſuiſque aliis proceribus regni Angliae, Salutem. Summonete Vicecomites meos ex meo praecepto, & ex parte mea eis dicite, ut reddant Epiſcopatibus meis, & Abbatiis totum Dominium, omneſque dominicas terras quas de Dominio Epiſcopatuum meorum & Abbatiarum, Epiſcopi mei & Abbates cis vel lenitate, vel timore, vel cupiditate dederunt, vel habere conſenſerunt, vel ipſi violentiâ ſuâ inde abſtraxerunt, et quod hactenus injuſtè poſſederunt de Dominio eccleſiârum mearum. Et niſi reddiderint, ſicut GOS ex parte mea ſummonebitis, vos ipſos velint nolint conſtringite reddere. Quod ſi quilibet alius, vel aliquis veſtrum quibus hanc juſtitiam impoſui, ejuſdem querelae fuerit, reddat ſimiliter quod de Dominio Eſicopatuum vel Abbatiarum mearum habuit, ne propter illud quod inde aliquis veſtrum habebit minus exerceat ſuper meos Vicecomites vel alios quicunque teneant dominium eccleſiarum mearum f. quàm. quod praecipio.

div.head: Breve Regis in ſubſidium Villanorum Abbatis S. Auguſtini Cantuar. ſe gravari querentium in taxatione 10mae & 15mae.
div.p:
Edwardus Dei gratiâ Rex Angliae, DominusScriptura 15. Vide pag 73. Hiberniae, & Dux Aquitaniae, Taxatoribus Decimae & Quintaedecimae in Comitatu Cantiae, Salutem. Ex parte dilecti nobis in Chriſto Abbatis S. Auguſtini Cantuar. nobis eſt oſtenſum, quod vos omnia bona & catalla Villanorum ipſius Abbatis in Comitatu praedicto, non deductis redditibus, ſervitiis & cuſtumis quae iidem Villani praefato Abbati reddunt & ſolvunt annuatim, quae quidem redditus, ſervitia & cuſtumae inter temporalia ipſius Abbatis ſpiritualibus ſuis annexa ad decimam ſunt taxata, et inde idem Abbas decimam ſolvit, taxaſtis, et decimam & quintamdecimam praedictas inde levare intenditis ad opus nostrum, in ipſius Abbatis et Villanorum ſuorum praedictorum praejudicium et gravamen: Nos nolentes praedictum Abbatem, pro eo quod ipſe de temporalibus ſpiritualibus ſuis annexis
decimam ſolvit in hac parte indebitè prae gravari, vobis mandamus, quod deductis redditibus, ſervitiis, et cuſtumis Villanorum praedictorum, quae inter temporalia praedicti. Abbatis ſpiritualibus annexa ad decimam ſic taxantur, et de quibus idem Abbas decimam ſolvit, ſicut praedictum eſt, reſidua bona et catalla eorundem Villanorum taxari, et dictas decimam et qnintamdecimam inde ad opus noſtrum levari faciatis, prout aliàs in hujuſmodi taxationibus fieri conſuevit. Et▪ ſi quid per vos à praefatis Villanis indebi • è levatum fuerit, id ſine dilatione reſtitui faciatis eiſdem. Teſte meipſo apud Pontefractum primo die Martii, anni regni noſtri ſeptimo.

div.head: Charta de Homagio facto pro terrâ de Gavelkind, ſicut de Villenagio.
div.p:
Sciant omnes tam poſteri quam praeſentesScriptura 16. Vidē pag 73. quod Wmus filius Wmi de Elmton, & Radulfus frater ſuus diviſerunt hereditatem ſuam de duabus villis Burne et Wilrintune, ſicut de Gavelikende in Curia S. Auguſtini,
in praeſentiâ Domini Rogeri electi ejuſdem eccleſiae & plurimorum Monachorum & Laicorum: & Radulfus relevavit in eadem Curia partem ſuam. Ipſe verò Radulfus de medietate iſtarum duarum villarum fecit homagium Abbati ſicut de Villenagio, & reddet de Burne gablum quinquaginta ſolid. quatuor terminis anni, dominicâ viz. Palmar. xxij. s. vj. d. in Nativitate S. Johannis tantundem, ad feſtum S. Michaelis tantundem, ad feſtum S. Thomae ante Nativitatem Domini tantundem, & tantundem ſervitii quantum ad idem Villenagium pertinet, faciet. Similiter de medietate de Wilrinton, idem Radulfus alios quinquaginta ſolidos, eodem modo, et eiſdem terminis reddet cum ſervitio. Ego autem R. Dei gratiá electus beati Auguſtini Cantuarienſis ejuſdemque loci conventus, hanc partem ſuae hereditatis praeſenti chartâ et ſigillo eccleſiae noſtrae eidem Radulfo confirmavimus. Hiis teſtibus quorum nomina ſubſcripta ſunt, Willmo filio Nigelli, Elya de Silingheld, Radulfo de S. Leodegario, Radulfo de Creye, Eylgaro de Eſture, Hugone Coſin, Stephano
de Renardinton, Alano de Reading, Daniele de Wyvelesberhe, Hamone de Solforde, Hamone de Aldeloſe, Alano de Legh, Rogero de Wadenhale, et pluribus aliis.

div.head: Chirographum pervetuſtum de Nuptiis contrahendis, & Dote conſtit • en • â.
div.p:
Here appeareth in this writing the agreement thatScriptura 17. Vide pag. 76.
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Godwine made with Byrhtric when he his daughter 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 wooed, that is firſt that he gives her one pounds 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 weight of gold Conditionally (and upon this conſideration) that ſhe accept of his speech, i. e. conſent to the agreement, or contract here made, and on theſe terms will become his wife. ſo as ſhe his agreement received, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & he giveth her thoſe lands at Strete with 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 all that thereto apperteineth, & in Burwaremerſh 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 one hundred and fifty acres, and withall. thereto thirty 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 oxen, & twenty cowes, & ten horſes, & ten bondmen. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 This was agreed. ſpoken at Kingſtone before Cnute 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 king▪ in Living the Archbiſhops preſence. witneſſe, & in 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 the Covents at Chriſt-church, & Aelfmeres (the) Abbats, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 and the Covents at S. Auguſtine, and Aethelwines 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 (the) Sheriffe, and Siredes th'elder, and Godwines 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
Wulfeyes ſonne, and Aelfsy child, and Eadmer 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 at Burham, and Godwine Wulfſtanes ſonne, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Charles the kings Miniſter. knight, and when men that maiden 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 fetchd to Brightling, then went of all this for ſurety. in 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 pledge Ael • gar Syredes ſonne, and Frerth prieſt of 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Foleſtone and of Dover Leofwine prieſt, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Wulfsy prieſt, and Eadred Eadelmes ſonne, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Leofwine Waerelmes ſonne, and Cenwold ruſt, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Leofwine Godwines ſonne at Horton, and Leofwine 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 the red, and Godwine Eadgi • es ſonne, and Leofſuh 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 his brother. And which ſoever of them longeſt liveth 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
ſeixe. take all inheritances. poſſeſſions aſwell that land that 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 I to them give as every thing. This thing is knowne 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
of each, o •
every. to all doughty. valiant men in Kent, & in Suſſex of Thanes 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 and of Churles, and this writing is tripartite. three-fold, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 one is at Chriſt church, a ſecond▪ another at S. Auguſtine, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , the third hath Byrhtric himſelf. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .

div.head: Teſtamentum Ethelſtani Etheling, filii regis Ethelredi, quo (inter alia) contulit Eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuariae, manerium de Holingburne, anno Chriſti 1015.
div.p:
In God Almighties name I Ethelſtan Prince 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 make knowne in this writing how I my ſubſtance & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 my poſſeſſions given have for Gods glory. love & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 my ſoules redemption, & my father Ethelredes 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 king that I it of obteined. earned, that is firſt that I 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 conſent that man ſet at liberty. ſet free every forfeited pledge. ſurety 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
Fortè mancipia. Vide Dictionar. noſti. in voce 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . Spelm. Gloſſar. verb. Domeſticus, pag. 222. col. 2. Item Concil. p. 403 & Ma • t. Patiſ. Add •
• am. p. 243. that I by contract. promiſe poſſ • ſſ • . ought. And I give in 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 with me where I me reſt to Chriſt & S. Peter thoſe 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 lands at Eadburghbery which I bought of my father 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
for. with two hundred marks of gold by weight, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , & for. with five pounds of ſilver, & that land at Meralefan 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 which I bought of my father for. with two 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 hundred marks and a halfe of gold by weight, & that 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 land at Mordune which my father me to let I give into 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
that place for our both ſoules, & I him this pray 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 for Gods love & for S. Mary & for S. Peters that it 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ſtand mought, & that ſword with ſilver hilt that 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Wolfriht made, & that gilt pouch, & that bracelet 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 which Wolfrihc made, & that drink-horne that I 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ere of that Covent bought at Ealdminſter. And I 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 will that men take that money which Athelwolds 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 widow me ought to yeild. pay which I for her ere 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 paid have, & diſpoſe it Elfsy biſhop to Ealdminſter 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 for my ſoule, that is twelve pounds numbred▪ by 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 tale. And I give to Chriſt-church in Canterbury 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 thoſe lands at Holingbourne and thoſe which thereto 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 appertaine, except that one plough-land that I to Siferth 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 given have. And thoſe lands at Garwaldintune, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & I give thoſe lands at Ritherfelde to the nuns 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 minſter of Saint Mary freely▪ gratis, & one ſilver 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 great piece of five pounds, & to New-minſter one 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
ſilver baſin of five pounds in that holy Trinities 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 name that the place is dedicated to. And I give to 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Shaftesbury to that holy C • ucifix. rood & to Saint Edward 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 thoſe vi. pounds which I to Edmund my brothr 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
made. known. committed have. And I give to my father Ethelred 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 King thoſe lands at Cealtune ſaving. except thoſe 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 eight hides which I to Aelmer my Miniſter given 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 have. And thoſe lands at Northtone, & thoſe lands 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 at Mulinton, & thoſe ſilver hilted ſwords which 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Wlkytel poſſeſſeth, & that brigandine that with Morkere 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 is, & thoſe horſes that Thurbrand me gave, & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 thoſe white horſes which Liefwine me gave. And I 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 give to Eadmund my brother thoſe ſwords which 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Offa King enjoyed. And thoſe ſwords with the hollow 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 hilt, & one javelin, and one ſilver tipped. hemmed 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 war-trumpet, and that land which I poſſeſſe in Eaſtangle. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 And thoſe lands at Peakeſdale. And I will 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
that men deliver every yeare one dayes victual. ferme to the 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 covent at Ely of this land on S. Etheldriths maſſeday 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & give likewiſe to the minſter one hundred 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 pence. & feed there on that day an hundred 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
needy. poore. Be ever this almes delivered yearly, poſſeſſe, i. e. whoſoever owes the land. ow 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 the land he that poſſeſſeth. oweth, whileſt Chriſtendom ſtandeth. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 And if he will not that almes performe who 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 that land hath, go that land to S. Etheldrith. And 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 I give to Eadrith my brother one ſilver hilted ſword. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . And I give to Elfsy biſhop one gilt Crucifix. croſſe which 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 is with Eadrith Syfleds ſon, & one black ſtede. And 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 I give to Elmer thoſe lands at Hamelden which he 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
ſometime. ere had. And I pray my father for God Almighties 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 love & for mine that he that confirm. give which I 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 to him given have. And I give to Godwine Wlnothes 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ſonne thoſe lands at Cunitune which his father ſometime. ere 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 poſſeſſed. And I give to Elfſith my nurſe. foſter-mother 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
for her great deſerving thoſe lands at Weſtune 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 which I bought of my father for. with three hundred 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 marks lacking a half of gold by weight. And I give 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 to Elfwine my maſſe-prieſt thoſe lands at Horelveſtune 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & thoſe ſwords which Wyther enjoyed. And 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 my horſe with my furniture. And I give to Eylmere 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 my i. Sewer, forte. diſh thane thoſe eight hides at Cateringetune, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & one diverſe-coloured ſtede & thoſe ſharpe 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
Fortè, a Cutlaſh. ſwords & my target. And I give to Syferth thoſe 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 lands at High-cliffe & one ſword & one horſe & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 my bowed ſhield. And I give to Ethelferrh Stameren 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & Lyving thoſe lands at Tywynge. And I give 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 to Liefſtane Liefwines brother what of that landeſtate 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 which I from. of his brother took. And I give 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 to Lyemare at Bygrove thoſe lands which I him ſometime. ere 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 from took. And I give to Godwine Drevelen thoſe 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 three hides of land at Little Gareſhale. And I give 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
to Edrith Wynfelds ſonne that ſword is marked with a hand. which the 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 hand is on marked. And I give to Elfwine my 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 miniſter that ſword which he to me ſometime ſold. ſometime gave. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . And I give to Elfnoth my ſword white, & to my 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Huntſman that ſtede which is at Colingeregge. And 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 tender men of my gold to Elurith at Berton & to 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Godwine Drevelen ſo much as Eadmund my brother 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 knowes that I to them of right to yeild ought. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . Now thank I my father with all humility in God 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Almighties name for that anſwer which (he) to me ſent 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 on Friday after midſummers maſſe-day by Elfgare 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Elfſtanes ſon, which was that he to me ſignified by 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
a meſſage from my father. my fathers meſſage that I might by Gods permiſſion 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & by his give my lands & my ſubſtance. poſſeſſions as 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 to me moſt expedeient ſeemed, i. e. Either to divine or ſecular uſes. either for God & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 for the world. And of this anſwer is to witneſſe 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Eadmund my brother & Elfsy biſhop, & Byrhtmer 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
Abbat & Eilmer Eluriches ſonne. Now pray I all the 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 wiſe men which my teſtament. will ſhall hear read either 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
Clerks. Clergie & Laics. Laity, that they be of aſſiſtance that 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 my teſtament. will ſtand may, ſith my father giveth leave 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 for my teſtaments wills ſtanding. Now declare I that all 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 thoſe things which I to God unto Gods church & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Gods ſervants given have be don for my deer 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 fathers ſoule Ethelred King & for mine & Elfrith 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 my grand-mother that me fedd, & for all theirs that 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 me to this eſtates. goods helped. And he that this 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
teſtament. will through any thing breaketh let him give an accompt 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 thereof to God Almighty, & to Saint Mary, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , & to Saint Peter, & to all thoſe which Gods name 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 do laud. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .

div.head: Charta Libertatum Eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuar. conceſſar. per Regem Henricum primum.
div.p:
H. Dei gratiâ Rex Anglorum, Epiſcopis,Scriptura 19. Vide pag. 123. Comitibus, Proceribus, Vicecomitibus, caeteriſque ſuis fidelibus Francis et Anglis in omnibus Comitatibus in quibus Achiepiſcopus Randulfus & monachi eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuariae terras habent amicubiliter Salutem. Notum vobis facio me conceſſiſſe eis omnes terras quas tempore Regis Eadwardi cognati mei, & tempore Willielmi patris mei habuerunt & Saca & So • ne on Strande & Streame, on Wode & Felde, Tolnes & Teames, & Grithbreces, & Hamſo • ne, & Foreſtealles, & Infangenes thioves, & Flemen feormthe ſuper ſuos homines infra burgos & extra in tantum & tam pleniter ſicut proprii miniſtri mei exquirere debent. Et etiam ſuper tot Thegenes quot eis conceſſit pater meus. EtThegenes. nolo ut aliquis hominum ſe intromittat niſi ipſi & miniſtri eorum, quibus ipſi committere voluerint, nec Francus nec Anglus:
propterea quia ego conceſſi Chriſto has conſuetudines pro redemptione animae meae, ſicut Rex Eadwardus & pater meus antehac fecerunt. Et nolo pati ut aliquis eas infringat, ſi non vult perdere amicitiam mea • Deus vos cuſtodiat.

div.head: Thus Engliſhed in the ſame Charter.

p.note: [] This anſwers not to the Latine; that, quot eis conceſſit pater meus; this, as I to them have granted.

div.head: Charta conſimilium libertatum Eccleſiae S. Auguſtini▪ Cantuar. conceſſarum per S. Edwardum Regem.
div.p:
Ego Edwardus Dei gratiâ Rex Anglorum, Scriptura 20. Vide pag. 112. & 123. Eadſino Archiepiſcopo, et Godwino Comiti, & omnibus ſuis Baronibus Canciae, Salutem. Sciatis me dediſſe Deo & S. Auguſtino & fratribus ut habeant eorum Saca & Socna, et pacis fracturam, et pugnam in domo factam, et viae aſſaltus, et latrones in terra ſua captos, latronumque ſuſceptionem vel paſtionem, ſuper illorum proprios homines infra Civitatem et extra, theloniumque ſuum in terra et in aqua, atque conſuetudinem quae dicitur Teames. Et ſuper omnes Allodiarios ſuos quos eis habeo datos. NecAllodia • ii. volo conſentire ut aliquis in aliqua re de his ſe intromittat, niſi eorum praepoſiti quibus ipſi hoc commendaverint, quia habeo has conſuetudines Deo datas et S. Auguſtino pro redemptione animae meae ita pleniter et liberè ſicut meliùs habuerunt tempore praedeceſſoris mei Knuti Regis, et nolo conſentire
ut aliquis haec infringat, ſicut meam amicitiam vult habere.

div.head: Epiſtola Gaufridi Supprioris & Monachor. Eccleſiae Cantuarienſis ad Regem Henricum 2. de lite inter eos & Baldvinum Archiepiſc.
div.p:
Excellentiſſimo Domino ſuo H. Dei gratiâScriptura 21. Vide pag. 67. & 101. Anglorum Regi G. Supprior & Conventus eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuar. flebilis & ultra modum afflictus Salutem & ſuſpiria flentium & afflictorum reſpicere. Cum ſcriptum ſit, Gloria in excelſis Deo, & in terra pax hominibus bonae voluntatis: ut pro bona voluntate in terris habita, gloriam habeatis in coelis, Serenitati veſtrae quem in nullo offendiſſe credimus vel recognoſcimus, ſupplicamus, ut ſi quid odii aut rancoris concepiſtis adverſus nos aut eccleſiam Cantuar. odio perſonae alicujus aut operis praeſentes temporis vel praeteriti, quod nos debeat reſpicere, pietatis intuitu remittatis, attendentes innocentiam noſtram, nec vindicantes aliorum peccata in nobis. Si peccavimus
publicè, puniamur, ſin autem, quòd eccleſia Cant. de quâ omnes Anglorum Reges,
〈◊〉 Can
•… dig
•…
non ſolùm fidem Chriſti, ſed & coronam Regni ſumpſerunt, qu • uſque modò libera extitit, captivatur & con • ulcatur ab hominibus, cum ſit mater omnium in regno Angliae manentium. In Chriſto Jeſu vobis dicimus, timemur ne novitates multae & malae ſubitò oriantur, quarum principia etſi nos ſenſimus, forſitan exitus alios quàm nos tanget nec tranſire permittet immunes, ſed involvet. Qui hanc novitatem non admiretur, quod Dominus Archiepiſcopus dicit nos debere de eo terras & poſſeſſiones noſtras tenere? cum jam per quingentos annos & eo ampliùs, à tempore ſcil. magni Theodori, Nota. qui terras partitus est, & utrique parti ſuam portionem aſſignavit, Conventus in pace poſſederit portionem ſuam, & liberè adminiſtraverit, quod & chartae Regum & Pontificum plenius atteſtantur, ex quarum tenore perſpicuum videre eſt, quod uſque ad haec infoelicitatis tempora, Archiepiſcopus nihil juris vel dominationis plus habebat in terris Monachorum, quàm Monachi in terrâ
Archiepiſcopi. Et ne ſuper hoc quiſquam dubitet, proferantur in medium charta S. Aedwardi Regis & Sancti Anſelmi Achiepiſcopi, & aliae multae Regum & Pontificum. Quod autem dicitur Lanfrancum dividiſſe terras, ideo eſt, quod cum Normanni, captâ Angliâ, omnium eccleſiarum terras occupaſſent, Rex Will. ad inſtantiam Lanfranci, eas reſignavit. Lanfrancum verò ſingulis eccleſiis reddidit quod antea poſſederant, ſibi autem quod ante ceſſorum fuerat ſuorum retinuit. Quod autem tempore Lanfranci non ſit facta terrae diviſio, teſtantur chirographia ante tempora beati Dunſtani facta inter Archiepiſcopos & Monachos de concambiis terrarum multarum: ſed & hoc atteſtantur ſcripta vetuſtiſſima quae linguâ Anglorum, Landbokes, id eſt, terrarum libros,Landbokes. vocant. Quia vero non erant adhuc tempore Regis Willielmi milites in Anglia, ſed Threnges, praecepit Rex, ut de eis milit • sTh • eng • s. fierent ad terram defendendam. Fecit autem▪ Lanfrancus Threngos ſuos milites: Monachi verò non fecerunt, ſed de portione ſua ducentas libratas terrae dederunt Archiepiſcopo,
ut per milites ſuos terras eorum defenderet, & ut omnia negotia eorum apud Curiam Romanam ſuis expenſis expediret. Ʋnde adhuc in totà terrâ Monachorum nullusNota. miles eſt, ſed in terrâ Archiepiſcopi. Terram tamen ducentarum librarum adhuc habent Archiepiſcopi: pro quibus omnibus valdè miramur, quòd vel talia dicit, vel quòd aſſenſum • i praebetis, quòd veſtrâ authoritate & nomine veſtro, per miniſtros veſtros res & poſſeſſiones noſtras invadit, cum nichil ad eum ſpectent, ſet nos teneamus poſt Deum in capite de vobis, ſicut & ipſe: quod manifeſtum eſt, decedentibus Archiepiſcopis, quia terrae eorum ſtatim confiſcantur, à ſeculo autem inauditum eſt, quod poſſeſſiones noſtrae confiſcatae fuerint aliquo tempore. Quapropter ſupplicamus, ut maturiùs pro Deo dum poteſtis haec corrigi faciatis, cum fortè tunc Fortè, voletis. velitis, cum non poteritis. potueritis. Valeat.

div.head: Donatio Wolgithae de manerio de Stiſted, A. D. 1046.
div.p:
Here appeareth in this writing how Wolgith givesScriptura 22. Vide pag. 85.
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
her ſubſtance after her departure, which to her the Almighty 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 God gave in life to uſe, that is then firſt 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 to my Lord his right Heriot. And I give that land 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 at Stiſtede with. by Gods teſtimony. witneſſe & my friends 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 to Chriſt-church to the Monks for i. c. ad victum. ſuſtenance, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , on this condition that Elikitel & Kytel my children 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 uſe thoſe lands for their lives time. dayes, & afterward go 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 that land to Chriſt-church without any deduction 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 for my ſoule, & for Elfwines my Lords, & for 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 all my children, & be halfe the men free after their 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
deaths. dayes. And I give to the church at Stiſtede 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
together w • th that. beſides that which I in life gave Eldemeſland. & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
withall. thereto Hyeken, that there be in all fifty acres in 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
champion field after my departure. And I give to Wolk & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Kytel my ſonnes that land at Walſingham, & at 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Charlton, & Herlingham. And I give to my two 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 daughters Gode & Bote Sexlingham & Summerledeton, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
& to the church at Sumerl. ſixteene acres 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 of land, & one acre of medow. And I give to Ealgyth 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 my daughter that land at Cherteker and at Aſhford, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , and the wood which I laid thereto. And I give to 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Godwine Earle and Harald Earle Frithton. And I give 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 to Chriſt-church to Chriſts altar one little 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 gilt Crucifi • . croſſe and one carpet, and I give to S. Edmund 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 two boned hornes. And I give to S. Etheldrith 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 one wollen kyrtel. And I give to S. Oſyth 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 halfe a pound of money. And I give to Auſtine one 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 carpet. And he that my will. teſtament bereaveth 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 which I now bequeathed. ordeined have with. by Gods witneſſe. teſtimony, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 bereaved let him be of theſe earthly joyes, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , & cut off him the Almighty Lord which all creatures 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 created & made from all Saints. holy mens communion 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
at. in Domeſday, & be he delivered to Satam the Devill 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & all his curſed companions into hell bottome, & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
there be tortured. periſh with Gods reprobates. deniers Or, Except he deſist from moleſting mine heires. without intermiſſion, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & mine heires never to trouble (ſ). Of this 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 is for witneſſe Edward King & many others. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .

div.head: Donatio terrarum apud Apoldre, Orpinton, Palſtre, Werhorne, Wittriſham, eccleſiae Chriſti Cantuariae per Aedſium Presbyterum, de conſenſu Cnuti Regis & Aelfgifae Reginae, ann. 1032.
div.p:
Here appeareth by. in this writing how Cnut KingScriptura 23. Vide pag. 120.
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 & Aelfgife his Lady gave to Eadſy their Prieſt 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 when he turned monk that he might diſpoſe. convey that 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 land at Apuldore as to himſelfe moſt pleaſing were. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . Then gave he it to Chriſt-church to Gods ſervants 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 for his ſoule, & he it bought that of the Covent for his 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 dayes & Aedwines with fower pounds, on that condition. contract 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 that men deliver every yeare to Chriſt-church 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 three weighs of cheeſe from that land, & three cados. bundles 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 of Eeles, & after his dayes & Aedwines go that 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 land into Chriſt-church, with meat and with i. e. entirely. men 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
even as it then improved. inriched is, for Eadſies ſoule, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 he bought that land at Werhorne of the Covent for 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 his dayes and Eadwines alſo with fower pounds, then 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 goeth that land forth with the other after his dayes & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Edwines to Chriſt-church with the ſtock. crop that 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 there then on is, & that land for his dayes at Berwick 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 which he obteined of his Lord Cnute king, & he 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 gives alſo thoſe lands at Orpington in his dayes for 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 his ſoule to Chriſt-church to Gods ſervants for 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
clothing. garment land, which he bought with eighty 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
Scrud-land. Huſtings weight. marks of white ſilver by Huſtings weight, & he gives 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 alſo thoſe lands at Palſtre & at Wittreſham after 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 his dayes & Edwines forth with the other to Gods 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ſervants for foſter-land for his ſoule. This bequeſtFoſter-land.
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 he giveth to the Covent on this condition. contract that they 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ever him well obſerve, & to him faithfull be in life & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 after life, & if they by. with any unadviſedneſſe with 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
him this condition. contract ſhall breake, then ſtands it in 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 his owne power how he afterwards his owne diſpoſe 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 will. Of this is for witneſſe Cnute King, & Aelfgife 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 his Lady, & Aethelnoth Archb. & Aelfſtan A b. & 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 the Covent at S. Auſtines, & Brihtric young & Aetheric 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 husbandman, & Thorth Thurkilles nephew, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Tofi, & Aelfwine prieſt, & Eadwold prieſt, and all the 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 Kings Counſellours, and this writing is tripartite. threefold, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 one is at Chriſt-church, and one at S. Auguſtines, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , and one hath Eadſy to. with himſelfe. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .
I have peruſed this learned Treatiſe of Gavelkynd, and judge it very fit to be publiſhed.
